alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Edgefield and central Aiken Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 844 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Aiken Municipal Airport, or 7 miles north of Aiken, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, Aiken Mall, Edgefield, USC Aiken, Aiken Municipal Airport, Citizens Park, Gloverville, Edgefield County Airport, Aiken State Park, Graniteville, Burnettown, Wagener, Salley, Monetta, Trenton, Windsor, Aiken Gopher Tortoise Heritage Preserve, Hopeland Gardens, Boyd Pond Park and Vaucluse. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 8 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
